snippet: The American convicted of spying for Israel was released on parole on Friday, but the Obama administration had no plans to let him move to Israel.
abstract: Jonathan J Pollard is released from federal prison on parole after serving 30 years of life sentence; Pollard is only American to be sentenced to life in prison for spying for ally; United States and Israeli authorities hope release will help heal longstanding disagreement centered around Pollard's conviction and sentencing.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and JODI RUDOREN
byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem. Jesse James DeConto contributed reporting from Butner, N.C.

lead_paragraph: The American convicted of spying for Israel was released on parole on Friday, but the Obama administration had no plans to let him move to Israel.

headline.main: Jonathan Pollard, American Who Spied for Israel, Released After 30 Years
headline.print_headline: As a Spy Leaves Prison, Raw Feelings Follow Him
